AddRealServers.document: This API is used to add the information of the origin server (server), which supports IP or the domain name.
AddRealServers.name: Adds an origin server

BindListenerRealServers.document:
This API (BindListenerRealServers) is used for the TCP/UDP listener to bind/unbind the origin server.
Note: This API unbinds the previously bound origin servers, and binds the origin servers selected for this call. For example, the previously bound origin servers are A, B and C, and the origin servers selected for this call are C, D and E, then the origin servers bound after this call will be C, D and E.
BindListenerRealServers.name: Binds listeners with an origin server.

BindRuleRealServers.document: This API is used to bind an origin server to the forwarding rules of layer-7 listeners. Note: This API unbinds all previously bound origin servers before binding those selected.
BindRuleRealServers.name: Binds forwarding rules with origin server.

CheckProxyCreate.document: This API (CheckProxyCreate) is used to query whether an acceleration connection with the specified configuration can be created.
CheckProxyCreate.name: Queries whether a connection can be created.

CloseProxies.document: This API (CloseProxies) is used to disable connections. If disabled, no traffic will be generated, but the basic configuration fee will still be incurred.
CloseProxies.name: Disables a connection

CloseProxyGroup.document: This API is used to disable a connection group. Once disabled, the connection group will no longer generate traffic, but the basic connection configuration fees will still be incurred every day.
CloseProxyGroup.name: Disables a connection group

CloseSecurityPolicy.document: This API is used to disable a security policy.
CloseSecurityPolicy.name: Disables a security policy

CreateCertificate.document: This API (CreateCertificate) is used to create the GAAP certificates and configuration files, including basic authentication configuration files, client CA certificates, server SSL certificates, GAAP SSL certificates, and origin server CA certificates.
CreateCertificate.name: Creates a certificate

CreateCustomHeader.document: This API is used to create a custom header of the HTTP/HTTPS listener. When client requests reach the listener, they will be forwarded to the origin with this custom hearer.
CreateCustomHeader.name: Creates a custom header

CreateDomain.document:
This API (CreateDomain) is used to create the access domain name for the HTTP/HTTPS listener. Clients request the backend data by accessing this domain.
This API only supports connections of version 3.0.
CreateDomain.name: Creates a access domain name for HTTPS listeners.

CreateDomainErrorPageInfo.document: This API is used to customize the error code of an error response to the specified domain name.
CreateDomainErrorPageInfo.name: Customizes the error code of an error response to the specified domain name.

CreateHTTPListener.document: This API (CreateHTTPListener) is used to create an HTTP listener in the connection instance.
CreateHTTPListener.name: Creates an HTTP listener.

CreateHTTPSListener.document: This API (CreateHTTPListener) is used to create an HTTPS listener in the connection instance.
CreateHTTPSListener.name: Creates an HTTPS listener.

CreateProxy.document: This API is used to create/replicate an acceleration connection with the specified configuration. To replicate a connection, the basic configuration parameters need to be set for the new connection, and `ClonedProxyId` is needed to identify the replicated connection.
CreateProxy.name: Creates a connection

CreateProxyGroup.document: This API (CreateProxyGroup) is used to create a connection group.
CreateProxyGroup.name: Creates a connection group

CreateProxyGroupDomain.document: This API (CreateProxyGroupDomain) is used to create the connection group domain name, and enable the domain name resolution.
CreateProxyGroupDomain.name: (Disused) Enables a connection group domain name

CreateRule.document: This API (CreateRule) is used to create the forwarding rules of HTTP/HTTPS listeners.
CreateRule.name: Creates listener forwarding rules.

CreateSecurityPolicy.document: This API is used to create security policies.
CreateSecurityPolicy.name: Creates security policies.

CreateSecurityRules.document: This API is used to add security policy rules.
CreateSecurityRules.name: Adds security policy rules.

CreateTCPListeners.document: This API (CreateTCPListeners) is used to batch create TCP listeners of single connections or connection groups.
CreateTCPListeners.name: Creates a TCP listener.

CreateUDPListeners.document: This API (CreateTCPListeners) is used to batch create UDP listeners of single connections or connection groups.
CreateUDPListeners.name: Creates an UDP listener.

DeleteCertificate.document: This API is used to delete a certificate.
DeleteCertificate.name: Deletes a certificate

DeleteDomain.document: This API (DeleteDomain) is only applicable to layer-7 listeners. It is used to delete the domain names of this listener, and all the rules under the domain name. All rules bound to the origin server are unbound automatically.
DeleteDomain.name: Deletes a forwarding rule based on domain names.

DeleteDomainErrorPageInfo.document: This API is used to delete a custom error code for a domain name.
DeleteDomainErrorPageInfo.name: Deletes a custom error code for a domain name

DeleteListeners.document: This API (DeleteListeners) is used to batch delete the listeners of a connection or connection group, including layer-4/7 listeners.
DeleteListeners.name: Deletes a connection listener.

DeleteProxyGroup.document: This API (DeleteProxyGroup) is used to delete a connection group.
DeleteProxyGroup.name: Deletes a connection group

DeleteRule.document: This API (DeleteRule) is used to delete the forwarding rules of HTTP/HTTPS listeners.
DeleteRule.name: Deletes a forwarding rule of a layer-7 listener.

DeleteSecurityPolicy.document: This API is used to delete a security policy.
DeleteSecurityPolicy.name: Deletes a security policy

DeleteSecurityRules.document: This API is used to delete security policy rules.
DeleteSecurityRules.name: Deletes a security policy rule.

DescribeAccessRegions.document: This API (DescribeAccessRegions) is used to query acceleration region (client access region).
DescribeAccessRegions.name: Queries acceleration regions

DescribeAccessRegionsByDestRegion.document: This API is used to query the available accelerator region based on the origin server region.
DescribeAccessRegionsByDestRegion.name: Queries available acceleration regions based on the origin server region.

DescribeAuthSignature.document: This API is used to get a request signature that can prevent parameter tampering in the process of triggering orders, getting quotes, or activating subscription services.
DescribeAuthSignature.name: Gets a request signature

DescribeBlackHeader.document: This API is used to query names of blocked custom headers.
DescribeBlackHeader.name: Queries the list of blocked custom headers

DescribeCertificateDetail.document: This API (DescribeCertificateDetail) is used to query certificate details, including the certificate ID, name, type, content, key, and other information.
DescribeCertificateDetail.name: Queries certificate details.

DescribeCertificates.document: This API (DescribeCertificates) is used to query the list of available certificates.
DescribeCertificates.name: Queries a server certificate list.

DescribeCountryAreaMapping.document: This API (DescribeCountryAreaMapping) is used to obtain the country/region code mapping table.
DescribeCountryAreaMapping.name: Obtains country/region code mapping table.

DescribeCustomHeader.document: This API is used to query the list of custom headers.
DescribeCustomHeader.name: Queries a list of custom headers

DescribeDestRegions.document: This API (DescribeDestRegions) is used to query an origin server region (i.e., the region in which the origin server locates).
DescribeDestRegions.name: Queries origin server region.

DescribeDomainErrorPageInfo.document: This API is used to query the custom error response to a domain name.
DescribeDomainErrorPageInfo.name: Queries the custom error response to a domain name

DescribeDomainErrorPageInfoByIds.document: This API is used to query the corresponding error response by a custom error ID.
DescribeDomainErrorPageInfoByIds.name: Queries a corresponding error response by a custom error ID

DescribeGroupAndStatisticsProxy.document: This is an internal API. It is used to query the information of connections and connection groups from which the statistics can be derived.
DescribeGroupAndStatisticsProxy.name: Queries the information of connections and connection groups from which the statistics can be derived.

DescribeGroupDomainConfig.document: This API (DescribeGroupDomainConfig) is used to obtain the domain name resolution configuration details of a connection group.
DescribeGroupDomainConfig.name: (Disused) Obtains domain name resolution configuration details of a connection group

DescribeHTTPListeners.document: This API (DescribeHTTPListeners) is used to query HTTP listener information.
DescribeHTTPListeners.name: Queries HTTP listener information.

DescribeHTTPSListeners.document: This API (DescribeHTTPSListeners) is used to query HTTPS listener information.
DescribeHTTPSListeners.name: Queries the HTTPS listener information.

DescribeListenerRealServers.document: This API (DescribeListenerRealServers) is used to query the origin server list of TCP/UDP listeners, including the list of bound origin servers and origin servers that can be bound.
DescribeListenerRealServers.name: Queries a listener origin server list.

DescribeListenerStatistics.document: This API is used to query listener statistics, including inbound/outbound bandwidth, inbound/outbound packets, and concurrence data. It supports granularities of 300, 3,600, and 86,400. Default value is the highest within the granularity range.
DescribeListenerStatistics.name: Queries listener statistics.

DescribeProxies.document: This API (DescribeProxies) is used to query the connection instance list.
DescribeProxies.name: Queries connection list

DescribeProxiesStatus.document: This API (DescribeProxiesStatus) is used to query the connection status list.
DescribeProxiesStatus.name: Queries connection status

DescribeProxyAndStatisticsListeners.document: This is an internal API. It is used to query the information of connections and listeners from which the statistics can be derived.
DescribeProxyAndStatisticsListeners.name: This example shows you how to query the information of listeners and connections from which the statistics can be derived.

DescribeProxyDetail.document: This API (DescribeProxyDetail) is used to query connection details.
DescribeProxyDetail.name: Queries connection details.

DescribeProxyGroupDetails.document: This API (DescribeProxyGroupDetails) is used to query connection group details.
DescribeProxyGroupDetails.name: Queries connection group details

DescribeProxyGroupList.document: This API (DescribeProxyGroupList) is used to pull the list of connection groups and the basic information of each connection group.
DescribeProxyGroupList.name: Pulls a connection group list.

DescribeProxyGroupStatistics.document: This API is used to query listener statistics, including inbound/outbound bandwidth, inbound/outbound packets, and concurrence data. It supports granularities of 300, 3,600, and 86,400. Default value is the highest within the granularity range.
DescribeProxyGroupStatistics.name: This example shows you how to query the connection group statistics.

DescribeProxyStatistics.document: This API is used to query listener statistics, including inbound/outbound bandwidth, inbound/outbound packets, concurrence, packet loss, and latency data. It supports granularities of 300, 3,600, and 86,400. Default value is the highest within the granularity range.
DescribeProxyStatistics.name: This example shows you how to query the connection statistics.

DescribeRealServerStatistics.document: This API is used to query the statistics of an origin server's health check results. Origin server status is displayed as 1 (normal) or 0 (exceptional). The queried origin server must be bound to a listener or rule, and the ID of the bound listener or rule must be specified for the query. This API supports displaying origin server status statistics at a 1-minute granularity.
DescribeRealServerStatistics.name: Queries the health check statistics of bound origin server (disused)

DescribeRealServers.document: This API is used to query origin server information. It can query all origin servers under the specified project name, and supports fuzzy query by specified IPs or domain names.
DescribeRealServers.name: Queries origin server information

DescribeRealServersStatus.document: This API (DescribeRealServersStatus) is used to query whether an origin server has been bound to a rule or listener.
DescribeRealServersStatus.name: This example shows you how to query the binding status of the origin server.

DescribeRegionAndPrice.document: This API (DescribeRegionAndPrice) is used to obtain the origin server regions and the bandwidth price gradient.
DescribeRegionAndPrice.name: Obtains an origin server region and a bandwidth price gradient.

DescribeResourcesByTag.document: This API (DescribeResourcesByTag) is used to query corresponding resource information by tags, including connection, connection group, and origin server.
DescribeResourcesByTag.name: Pulls resource list based on tags

DescribeRuleRealServers.document: This API (DescribeRuleRealServers) is used to query forwarding rules-related origin server information, including information of origin servers that can be bound and have been bound.
DescribeRuleRealServers.name: This example shows you how to query the origin server information of forwarding rules.

DescribeRules.document: This API (DescribeRules) is used to query all rule information of a listener, including the domain names, paths, and list of bound origin servers. For version 3.0 connections, this API returns the advanced authentication configuration information of the domain name.
DescribeRules.name: Queries forwarding rule information.

DescribeRulesByRuleIds.document: This API is used to pull the list of rules based on rule ID. It supports pulling 1 to 10 rules at a time.
DescribeRulesByRuleIds.name: Pulls the list of rules based on rule ID

DescribeSecurityPolicyDetail.document: This API is used to obtain security policy details.
DescribeSecurityPolicyDetail.name: Obtains security policy details

DescribeSecurityRules.document: This API is used to query the list of security rules based on security rule ID. It supports querying 1 to 20 security rules at a time.
DescribeSecurityRules.name: Queries the list of security rules based on security rule ID

DescribeTCPListeners.document: This API (DescribeTCPListeners) is used to query the TCP listener information of a single connection or connection group.
DescribeTCPListeners.name: Queries the TCP listener list

DescribeUDPListeners.document: This API (DescribeUDPListeners) is used to query the UDP listener information of a single connection or connection group.
DescribeUDPListeners.name: Queries the UDP listener list

DestroyProxies.document: This API (DestroyProxies) is used to terminate a connection. If terminated, no fees will be incurred.
DestroyProxies.name: Terminates a connection.

InquiryPriceCreateProxy.document: This API (InquiryPriceCreateProxy) is used to create the price inquiries of acceleration connections.
InquiryPriceCreateProxy.name: Creates acceleration connection price inquiries.

ModifyCertificate.document: This API (ModifyCertificate) is used to modify a domain name certificate of a listener. domain name certificate. This API is only applicable to connections of version 3.0.
ModifyCertificate.name: Modifies the certificate of a domain name.

ModifyCertificateAttributes.document: This API is used to modify certificate name and content.
ModifyCertificateAttributes.name: Modifies certificate attributes

ModifyDomain.document: This API (ModifyDomain) is used to modify domain names of listeners. For connections of version 3.0, it supports modifying certificates of the domain names.
ModifyDomain.name: Updates the domain name of a listener forwarding rule.

ModifyGroupDomainConfig.document: This API (ModifyGroupDomainConfig) is used to configure the nearest access domain name of a connection group.
ModifyGroupDomainConfig.name: (Disused) Configures the nearest access domain name of a connection group

ModifyHTTPListenerAttribute.document:
This API (ModifyHTTPListenerAttribute) is used to modify the HTTP listener configuration information of a connection. Currently only supports modifying listener name.
Note: Grouped connections currently do not support HTTP/HTTPS listeners.
ModifyHTTPListenerAttribute.name: Modifies HTTP listener configuration.

ModifyHTTPSListenerAttribute.document: This API (ModifyHTTPSListenerAttribute) is used to modify HTTPS listener configurations. It currently do not support connection groups and connections of version 1.0.
ModifyHTTPSListenerAttribute.name: Modifies HTTPS listener configuration.

ModifyProxiesAttribute.document: This API (ModifyProxiesAttribute) is used to modify instance attributes (currently only supports modifying connection name).
ModifyProxiesAttribute.name: Modifies connection attributes.

ModifyProxiesProject.document: This API (ModifyProxiesProject) is used to modify the project to which a connection belongs.
ModifyProxiesProject.name: Modifies the connection project

ModifyProxyConfiguration.document: This API (ModifyProxyConfiguration) is used to modify connection configurations. You can expand or reduce the capacity based on current business requirements. It only supports connections with a Scalarable of 1. Scalarable can be obtained via DescribeProxies API.
ModifyProxyConfiguration.name: Modifies connection configuration.

ModifyProxyGroupAttribute.document: This API (ModifyProxyGroupAttribute) is used to modify connection group attributes. It currently only supports modifying connection group name.
ModifyProxyGroupAttribute.name: Modifies connection group attributes.

ModifyRealServerName.document: This API (ModifyRealServerName) is used to modify origin server names.
ModifyRealServerName.name: Modifies the origin server name

ModifyRuleAttribute.document: This API (ModifyRuleAttribute) is used to modify forwarding rule information, including health check configuration and forwarding policies.
ModifyRuleAttribute.name: Modifies forwarding rule information.

ModifySecurityRule.document: This API is used to modify security policy rule names.
ModifySecurityRule.name: Modifies a security policy rule name.

ModifyTCPListenerAttribute.document: This API (ModifyTCPListenerAttribute) is used to modify the TCP listener configuration of a connection instance, including health check configuration and scheduling policies.
ModifyTCPListenerAttribute.name: Modifies TCP listener configuration.

ModifyUDPListenerAttribute.document: This API (ModifyUDPListenerAttribute) is used to modify the UDP listener configuration of a connection instance, including modification of listener names and scheduling policies.
ModifyUDPListenerAttribute.name: Modifies UDP listener configuration.

OpenProxies.document: This API (OpenProxies) is used to enable one or more connections.
OpenProxies.name: Enables a connection.

OpenProxyGroup.document: This API is used to enable all connections in a connection group.
OpenProxyGroup.name: Enables a connection group

OpenSecurityPolicy.document: This API is used to enable a security policy.
OpenSecurityPolicy.name: Enables a security policy

RemoveRealServers.document: This API is used to delete the added origin server (server) IP or domain name.
RemoveRealServers.name: Deletes an origin server

SetAuthentication.document: This API (SetAuthentication) is used for the advanced authentication configuration of connections, including authentication methods and their certificates. If only supports connections of version 3.0.
SetAuthentication.name: Advanced authentication configuration

AccessConfiguration.document: List of acceleration regions in a connection group, including acceleration regions and their bandwidth and concurrence configuration.

An information list of the origin servers to bind.
If there are origin servers bound already, they will be replaced by this new origin server list.
If this field is empty, it indicates unbinding all origin servers of this rule.
If the origin server scheduling policy type of this rule is weighted round robin, you need to enter `RealServerWeight`, i.e., the origin server weight. If this field is left empty or for other scheduling types, the default origin server weight is 1.

CertificateType

members.document:
Certificate content. URL encoding. Where:
If the certificate type is basic authentication, enter username/password pair for this parameter. Format: “username:password”, for example, root:FSGdT. The password is `htpasswd` or `openssl`, for example, openssl passwd -crypt 123456.
When the certificate type is CA/SSL certificate, enter the certificate content for this parameter in the format of ‘pem’.
members.name: CertificateContent

members.document: URL-encoded key content. This parameter is required only when the certificate type is SSL certificate. Its format is `PEM`.
